description:
Seemingly one of the last burgers + fries for under $10.

Been going to this spot for 5+ years and the quality has not changed for the worse, which is pleasantly surprising!

Keep doing what you guys are doing!
author: Dennis A.

description:
Went here twice recently (both Oct 2018) and got food poisoning / diarrhea the second time. I know, so unlucky. I hate giving bad reviews, especially to places that are neighborhood institutions, so soon after moving to the mission. But they haven't even claimed their yelp page yet, after so many years of being in business, so I can only conclude they don't really care. 

The food sure tasted good but I can't overlook the diarrhea I'm now dealing with which has kept me up half the night. To me it signals that something isn't quite right with their food preparation methods.

I ordered the 1/4 lb junior burger with fries and a banana milkshake. Price wasn't bad at 12.75. Pay cash! 

Come here at your peril! You may be ripped off with weird credit card stuff, have your car towed or spend half the night sitting on the crapper.
author: Zoe L.

description:
High 3 stars. We walk by Whiz Burgers all the time and have always been curious - are they any good? How do they stay in business? (They always seem empty)

Turns out they have pretty good burgers. Still unclear how they are still around, but turns out they are pretty historic and used to be a legit drive through (turned parking lot. Maybe that's how they stay afloat nowadays). 

On top of the decent burger, there's also no wait, it's cheap, and they have a great banana shake. It's worth a stop by here to try it out!

THE FOOD:

* Garlic Fries ($4.95) - 2.5 stars
The fries, while thick cut (which I like), were too dry. Also, this smelled strongly of garlic, but when we opened it, it looked like plain fries. Where was the garlic? We could taste it, but not as strongly as when the fries are covered with freshly chopped garlic. 

* Fresh Banana Shake ($4.70) - 4 stars
Usually I avoid banana in any smoothie I get as I feel it's overpowering, but here it tasted great! Made fresh, nice thick texture.

* Whiz Burger ($8.75) - 3.5 stars
Good! This is the only burger that comes on a French Roll, which while more classy, makes for a drier/crunchier bread. Otherwise the ingredients are fresh, and they are nicely balanced. For the patty, I asked for "medium rare" and I think the guy chuckled.. not sure if they do that, and mine was pretty much a medium.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I tried to place for the first time this past weekend and loved it. 

Mind you I wouldn't say their burgers, shakes or fries are going to blow your mind. 

BUT it is good food. 

Waffle fries are obviously a must and they were perfectly cooked when I got them. I really wish they would add more picnic tables in the surrounding parking lot area and stay open late. Those two things with a combination of throwing up some string lights(this is key for millennials let's be honest) annnnnnd this place would be booming with late night business! There food is good, but I bet I would say it's incredible with a sufficient amount of alcohol in my system. Just some thoughts.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Hello good hole in the wall old fashioned burger spot to eat at! I am not a sf local and I want to say based on the volume of customers it's more of a local place. You have the option to eat in your Car or at the benches .... bring wipes or napkins.  Ordered for my husband and kids ! I loveeee the criss cut fries ! You can taste the banana in the milkshake ! Not overpowering not to thick or runny ! We all ordered a bacon cheeseburger , nice big slices of bacon. You are able to actually smell
Your food being prepared! So when they called out for our food it was straight from the grill nice and hot. I personally don't mind the location being that it's not a commercialized burger joint. Just bring wipes !
author: Adriana C.

description:
I had the combo meal here and it was okay. For about $7, and an additional 75 cents for cheese, this puts this meal at around the fast food price. But even with that, the food didn't really do any better.

The burger itself felt really boring, like something I would have gotten if I did a BBQ get together at home. The fries didn't taste that much better either, and they charge for every little thing (like ranch).

Overall, will probably be a pass in the future.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Came here by myself about a month ago.. perfect.  Nice day, sat outside, great burger and he even let me use the employee only restroom

I bring my family since I enjoyed it last time and it was a whole different ball game.  First, I guess it's called "the whiz" for a reason... it smells like piss everywhere.  There are a lot of homeless in the area, I get it... but they need to hose the area down very, very often if that be the case because it's difficult to eat when you want to vomit from the smell.

Secondly, they screwed up our order.  So I go back to get the water and fries they missed and he says "he didn't charge me for the fries"... okay, fine... so I hand him my credit card and he says all credit card charges are minimum $7...really??  I just spent $40 bucks on food!  my wife was livid.  Needless to say, I'll stick with In and Out Burgers... MUCH cheaper and MUCH better and friendlier customer service.
author: Bruno V.

description:
Just popped into this SF institution for the first time in about 30 years and I find myself thinking "Why did I wait so long to come back?"  Awesome burgers my gal got a single with american cheese, I got a double with swiss....They were delicious, and the prices were super fair for what we got.  We also got some onion rings to share and while they were great I gotta say I expected a larger portion for $4.75.
Safe part of the Mission, private parking lot, what's not to love?
We're coming back soon Whiz Burgers.....Thanks much!
author: Jim P.

description:
4 stars for being practical(!) in a neighborhood where lines often exceed 30 minutes for what should be basic grub. So glad I didn't have to pine away-- ruminating over the nature of  hunger and the whims of human desire--to get this burger.

*also, currently on keto, and when I asked for "a bacon burger with everything but the bun"--I got a solid protein style burger with plenty of lettuce, tomato, etc. 

A bit rough around the edges, but they deliver the goods.
author: Nick S.

description:
5 stars for the food, minus one star for the obvious.
With an outdoor eating area right in the Mission, yeah it's gonna be a little dirty.
But the burgers are damn good! Reminds me a bit of 5 Guys. Ingredients are fresh and delicious.
Parking usually isn't a problem, as they have their own lot around the stand.
I have only come here for the burgers, fries, and onion rings, so I can't vouch for anything else, but when I want a burger in the Mission and don't feel like a huge Zeitgeist burger, Whiz is the place! 
Order your food and bring it to the bar or eat it in your car if the eating area is that much of an issue for you. The food tastes the same no matter where you eat it :) 
The guys working there are nice and make really good food. 
Just close your eyes and eat a really good cheeseburger!
author: Kat R.

description: Good, greasy and inexpensive burgers.  I suggest calling in your order ahead of time.
author: David G.

description:
Food:

Phillie cheese steak - this is what I usually get when I'm here.  It's not bad as an option in the neighborhood for lunch.  Pretty standard fair though.

Seasoned fries - this is probably a must with any burger or cheese steak.  Waffle cut.   A little hit or miss on how over cooked they are.

Root beer float - these are good for sure.  Usually it's overflowing so kind of hard to transport on a rainy day.

Service: just ok.  

Ambiance: well it's pretty hole in the wall but definitely has that drive in feeling.  Though the area itself does have a lot of homeless people.

Overall:  I'd go back since it's an option in the area for lunch but pretty average.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Solid burgers! I really enjoyed the Whiz which is differentiated by having avocado slices and being wrapped in a lettuce bun.  Flavor was really good and much better than you would expect from a small stand with fast burgers.  While the prices are a little bit on the high side for a fast burger (probably about double In'N'Out pricing) it comes with the territory - specifically the territory of a small place without the purchasing power of a chain, renting in San Francisco.

The primary reason I give it 3* rather than 4 though is because I felt extremely lethargic after eating the burger.  That leaves me feeling the food is really not that fresh even if it is tasty.  The milkshakes and fries both lacked a depth of flavor which also indicates that they are not using fresh ingredients.

I would definitely stop in if I was hungry in the area or if it is late night.  Would be a great late night drunk stop given the awesome flavor.  Late you won't mind the lethargy.  Might even help you....zzzzzzz
author: Tarek S.

description: I moved back into the neighborhood after being gone for 20 years. A lot has changed, but this place stayed the same. Delicious as always
author: Vern S.

description: I drive miles to get this turkey burger! Best meal deals in the city, friendly workers, and great food. I've never been disappointed by any food that I've bought here. They are my favorite burger spot in the city. I'm taking away a star because one time I ordered on yelp drove over and they were out of turkey patties, make sure u check to ensure they have your food by calling. Other than that, I love whiz burgers.
author: Brandy W.

description:
I really want to like whiz... the burgers are like a whataburger (from the south) so that's cool for Cali... everything else on the menu is ehhh basic. This place would be a 4 star if most items were half the price. I got a chicken sandwich & philly cheese to try new items from menu last 2x I went here, thoroughly disappointed. 

Let's just be real, their location and parking lot is the only reason they are in business. Ok maaaaybe their history, but even historical spots close (see joes cable car on mission, R.I.P. with that food poisoning they gave me in its later years)
author: John O.

description: Good sized tasty burgers.  Fries are good also.  Onion rings not worth it.  I got the Jr. burger which seems like the size of a whopper.   Next time will try the whiz burger
author: Dkac C.

description:
The burger and onion rings that I had were so good. They were perfectly cooked and built. The bun fit the patty just right, and there was just the right amount of tomatoes and lettuce. I did find it odd that the assumed condiment was mustard. Luckily, I enjoy mustard on my burger. But people have pretty aggressive feelings about mustard and I could see someone being pretty disappointed if this amazing burger came to them with a large amount of mustard on it.

I want to give this place five stars so badly, but it was pretty dirty. And I know it's a burger shack in the mission, but I don't know if that's an excuse for dead bugs on the counter, in the window, and on the menu. I am glad I came and I will be back, hopefully I can update this review.
author: Isabella G.

description: Classic greasy burgers and fries. Go while you still can. You know this joint is being turned into condos sometime in the next few years. It's in evitable. And it will be sad, because this is a classic spot with old-school benches for seating. Next time I'm back I have to try their milkshake
author: David A R.

description:
This is exactly what you think it is: an old-school, no-nonsense, mom and pop burger drive-in joint. The food is good, not great. The prices are appropriate for a non-chain operation. It mainly has its vibe going for it. I stop by if I'm in the neighborhood. 

I hope these places stay in business. They're just doing their own thing.
author: Frank W.

description:
Solid burgers with fresh ingredients.

I also got the chili cheese fries, which were more chili than fries, but not bad.

Glad this place is in the mission, great when you're in the mood for an old-fashioned burger, and they have an extensive menu that I'm curious to try.
author: Jade M.

description:
Love this place. They make a damn decent burger, one of the few good ones in the mission. I think some places like garahe best them yet, but it's certainly the best choice in the area. Way better than wezburger. 
It's got a really fun old timey vibe, how it's an outdoor shack instead of a sit down place. 
I'm digging it but I wish their burgers with a bit messier juicer
author: Chris B.

description: Ordered a mushroom burger, onion rings, espresso shake. Order totalled $17.34! I could have eaten at Hodad's for that so the food better be worth it, right? Fell short in flavor, but the food was cooked perfectly and fresh. Not sure I will want to visit here again, as it was just too expensive for a guy who's been spoiled by Nation's, Junkyard, Yak's and Hodad's for the same price. The outdoor seating leaves little to be desired with the homeless always nearby, begging, but there was a parking lot on the property which makes this place easy to get in/out of as this place does not have a drive thru as the name may otherwise insinuate.
author: Bill R.

description: First ate there in the 60's. It was great then and still is now. Enjoyed many a meal back then through high school and then while working @17th st & Potrero. Tried to eat there as often as I can since then. So I can say I've enjoyed great burgers,fries and shakes now for over 50 years. It's truly the last of the old time burger stands.
author: Joe N.

description:
For what it is it's so amazing.
Drive-in style burger with all the fixings, greasy fries, and banana milk shake that is out of this freakin world. 
Plus you get to experience the drama of S Van Ness in all its glory. People running red lights, pretentious bike riders cursing at cars... And crazy people coming up to you giving lectures about how the military is all effed up and by the way can I have some change?
Freakin glorious
author: Gillian K.

description:
Not bad, but it's not Uncle Boys. 

Simple burgers are sometimes the best. Fries were good but I appreciate more salt/seasoning. The shake was to die for haha.

This is what we call a heart attack waiting to happen. A delicious one.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Good food and really good service! Just don't call in to order the phone does not work well, i called in about 5 times, and they will mess up your order the regular day to day guy cashiers are really nice people i always leave them a good tip since they always get my order right. But today i called in and there was a young asian man who messed up on the order i called in and instead of giving me what i ordered he gave me something else and when i had told him thats not what i ordered he replied in a rude way with attitude instead of explaining what went wrong. so instead of waiting after i got unnecessary attitude  by the cashier i just left. I am a cashier as well and i understand there will be mistakes like that but thats no excuse to talk to a customer especially when i have been a frequent customer for 18 years i live down the street and after that incident i will not be coming back.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
This place rocks! Best fries in the city!!!

As a Dutch person I am used to REALLY yummy
French fries and other deep fried foods you can get everywhere at snackbars that are on every corner of every street (almost :p)

But the fries here are really yummy!! I mostly just come here to get the fries and the milkshake to take home :-) 

If you like milkshakes this is the place To be!!! Fresh banana!!
author: Styn V.

description:
Ok. I'd read that a prominent SF chef loves this place.

I thought, if it's good enough for him, it's good enough for me.

Yes, it does have an overall decrepit look about it.

There's no denying that this joint could use some serious TLC.

But, we can all use a little, or a lot, of TLC, can't we?

I saw that they have a perfect health score.  I found this reassuring.

So, crumbling facade aside, I focused on the food.  Meaning...the burger.

How surprised was I (very) when I took my first bite of the Whiz Burger.  It was fresh, it was tasty.  Simple & a little messy.  That's good.  A lot of previous reviewers have called it classic, & that's exactly what it is...

A classic burger.

It's very reminiscent of an old school backyard burger from a prior era.  

A burger that Edith would have made for Archie Bunker.

If it's good enough for Archie Bunker...

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
A very recognizable burger place on Van Ness--you definitely can't miss it as you drive by!

Tried this place out of curiosity, and I would say the food here is average. The food items seem cheap at first, but they charge you extra for cheese (huh?) and other items. In general the burgers are soft and just the right size, which kind of reminds me of Shake Shack from the east coast.

In general, I would say this is a pretty average burger joint--it looks much more exciting than the food it actually serves. Feel free to come by to try it once, but I doubt I will go back since there are plenty of food places in SF.
author: Henry L.

description: I'm born and raised in The City, and I finally got to stop by for a burger, fries and a shake. Fries were great, as was the Mango Shake, burger was pretty damn good too ! Nice people working the counter too ! Hubby had a steak sandwich that was "just okay", (but he does get a little picky about steak hence the four star review vs. a five star review).
author: Lee P.

description: ORDER THE BANANA SHAKE. It's made with fresh bananas and is one of the most delicious beverages in the Bay Area. Everything here is fine, if unexceptional. Order to go - unsavory characters like to loiter at the seating area.
author: David C.

description: this is a heaven on earth. i mostly eat really healthy food, but every now and then i NEED my whiz.
author: Zelda S.

description:
:( A bit of a disappointment.
I stopped by to pick up 2 shakes. I chose chocolate & mango. The mango was decent but the chocolate was horrible. The wait was very long- in the time I waited I could have made the shake myself :/ . The chocolate shake tasted like it was made with Hershey's syrup :(:(:(.
The prices were very reasonable.
I would come again to try the banana shake & burger & fries.
It would be really nice if they had an outside heat lamp for their customers.
author: Ashley G.

description:
I love stepping back into history of this walk-up, drive-in looking place out of the 1950s. (Actually, it was built in 1950).   Living in SF for years, I stumbled upon this place once walking home from work, and enjoy visiting it whenever I'm back in the city.  

Oh, I almost forgot to mention the food -  typical greasy drive-in style burgers.   You're going mostly for the atmosphere, and get pleasantly surprised by the burgers and shakes.
author: Peter K.

description: This place is amazing. Old school feel to it. Best burger in the mission, milk shakes to!
author: Mickey C.

description: Hell yeah! Burger had tons of flavor. Chili cheese fries were average, but still damn good!
author: Adidas W.

description:
Walked home the wrong way and couldn't help but stop by this retro joint!

It looked promising, and the wait indicated that the food was fresh. The chicken wings were piping hot, crunchy, and packed with flavor. The fries bummed me out though. I ate two and threw the rest away. 

Solid strawberry milkshake as well. I'll come back for the shake, but prefer korean chicken wings over these dry ones.
author: Michelle N.

description: Awesome burger been going here since I was a kid always cheers me up! The burger is built to perfection and has never let me down
author: Jordan M.

description: I love this place!  The milkshakes are simply amazing, especially the coffee flavor.  For the price point they make a really good veggie burger and fries too.  Definitely give this one a go!
author: Paul V.

description:
Fast becoming my guilty pleasure...

Driven by here for years, always grabbed my attention. Could it possibly be true? A fantastic, old school burger in SF? 

Whiz Burger, fries, Banana shake. Why, yes! Delicious!! The way the cheese melts around the bacon, sliced down the middle, wrapped like a gift! And those fries! As for the shake, I'm not really into bananas. Until now.

I can feel the pounds packing on. And I just don't care.
author: Elizabeth Q.

description:
I think one of the previous reviews hit the nail on the head "greasy, hot, fresh, disgusting, and perfect."

Whiz Burger doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. Once you accept that, you will be happy. 

This place is a hangover go-to. Garlic fries are greasy, soggy, mega garlicky, and delicious. Burgers are OK. Their shakes are legit. I do not recommend the cheese steak.
author: Marz C.

description: Three words: Fresh Banana Shake. It's amazing!!! I had my first one when I had terrible morning sickness and the only thing that even remotely sounded appealing was a milkshake. I'm now 8 months pregnant, and even after drinking several of these shakes over the months, I still love them! Not too thick but still creamy, with real banana blended in. Absolutely delicious -- definitely the best shake in town!
author: D. S.

description:
Look at SF's top 10 burger places and Whiz is one of them! Don't let the looks put you off! The moment you open the brown bag with fries and you take a look at the perfectly crisped potato sticks, your heart starts beating faster! But it's only after you take the first bite into your burger that you let your guards fully down and admit to yourself that it's love at first bite! 
I had the quarter pound burger with added cheese and mushrooms and it was the best I'd had in loooong! Not a bit greasy as some others described it! It was really good, but hey! Don't expect a gourmet experience here! Am sure it's gonna be my go-to burger place when the craving hits again. Two thumbs up to Whiz!
author: Alek K.

description: Great burgers  ! Love the fries they give you a big portion!!!  Wonderful service always get order right , parking lot easy parking for the mission that a super plus. I've been coming here for years . I would Recommend to all enjoy !
author: Mario G.

description:
Whiz Burger: It's just the best.

They have a veggie burger! You can add avocado!

The seasoned (waffle) fries are delicious. And the root beer float is a tall foamy classic at the lowest price in town.
author: Megan G.

description:
Support small local businesses! :-)
My boyfriend and I were looking for a quick burger place to go to and came across Whiz Burgers on Yelp. We got good vibes all around from the place, the employee who took our order, as well as the other customers eating. I ordered the junior burger combo with garlic fries & my boyfriend ordered the bacon burger combo with crisscut fries. It was all super good! And they definitely overhand the fries, which was rad. The ranch was tasty (we're really picky about our ranch haha).
author: Mika C.

description:
I normally get the Whiz Burgers with fries and a banana shake. Always delicious and the service is prompt. This location is also good for people watching.

Unfortunately on my most recent visit I paid using my credit card only to find later that an extra $10 had been added to the tip despite tipping fairly in my opinion for the above meal. Won't be going back anytime soon unless I know I have cash on hand.
author: Shelaya L.

description:
Easily one of my favorite burger places in the city. 
Whiz burger with crosscut fries and a shake
Never have had a bad experience with this place and always happy&full after one of their burgers
author: Mandy F.

description:
This is a counter, drive in style burger joint that has a super retro feel like you'd see on a cross country road trip.

I had a fries craving and had always wanted to check this place out. They don't have late night hours unfortunately (and surprisingly) though. 

The large fries cost about $3 and I did have to wait awhile, but the the fries were totally worth the wait. The came out piping hot and were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside -- so, just right! 

I can't say anything for the burgers or other menu items, but I did notice they did have a Chicken Teriyaki dish which seems odd and out of place, but a guy in front of me did order that. He sat at the counter and ate the whole thing. There's also a couple of picnic tables to sit at too.

They have a small parking lot too which is convenient.

This seems like a great local spot with a lot of regulars.
author: Rebecca G.

description: philly cheese steak!!!!!!!!! So good. Omg. I expected it to be sub-par but honestly it was so good. Props
author: Tessa C.

description: 3rd Gener SF-er.  All of us thru the generations ate here.  It's okay.  As like others, the fries are meh...I never order them.  It's OG.  My mom ate here in the 60's while still a kid.  I'm glad to see it's still up and running.  Kudos!
author: LennyLi S.

description: OMG! Best burger ever! Definitely go for the whiz burger. The entire sandwich was exceptional. The meat, avocado, bacon, all was perfect. Freshness score was a 5 as well. Visiting family, we are from San Diego, and this will be a must return. Do not be fooled by the looks of the place, or neighborhood. They had a 92 on the health inspection. Loved it, the end.
author: Scott B.

description:
Gee whiz.

How is this place 1) still in business in an era of gentrification and 2) still serving burgers for less than $5.

Perhaps because the friendly staff is serving freshly grilled chicken, lettuce, tomato, pickles and onions on a sesame bun that are quite good. 

No question about that.
author: Jason B.

description: Finally made it to this place and it was glorious!  I know it's a burger joint but I have no power over my order if there are hotdogs or corn dogs on the menu...and that's what I got.  They slice the dog in half and serve it on a hoagie-ish bun which was great, sat flat, no spills, awesomely spicy.  Corn dog was properly fried and delicious.  Solid milkshake...the place is open air in a so-so part of town so keep an eye out for panhandlers.  Don't expect anything fancy from this place other than good food.  I'm surprised people are complaining about the neighborhood or the service, seriously, what did you expect??
author: Yadira A.

description:
This place is freakin' great, and I'm not sure why the other reviews are so polarized. (Although, the one about the car getting towed from the parking lot is pretty funny). However, you can't hold that against them in a review about food. Plus, there are a number of other snarky comments related to the neighborhood and it's "up-and-coming" appearance, but whatever.

This is pretty much the ultimate burger drive in. It has hilarious (and original decor), a cool retro feel. The whiz burger is pretty much where it's at. Bacon, avocado, burger, all on a french roll, sliced at a diagonal through the center. Mmmm, delicious. Fries are good too. I suspect the other items are good too, but I can't really vouch for them. We did try the banana shake, which was delicious and tasted like it had a whole banana blended up in there (which it probably did!). 

Check this place out the next time you've had one beer too many at a bar down the street. You won't regret it.
author: Brent W.

description: Love this place,   Food is always good,  basic burgers, fries n shake....   Old style drive in.   Good value for SF eats.
author: Mike S.

description:
The place screams SKETCHY with a capital "SK", but the food itself isn't so bad and the prices sure are cheap. My boyfriend is a good ol' American guy who loves his red meat, and his craving for burgers and other greasy, unhealthy American goodies brought us here one balmy summer night.

I went with the chicken wings and fries combo because fried meat and potatoes is one of the greatest food combinations ever invented. The wings were tender but tiny, so if you're hungry do not go for just 7, which I thought would be enough. The batter was nice and salty, but lacked other seasoning so came across as kind of bland. 

My boyfriend got the Whiz Burger, which comes with avocado. It was deeeeelicious and actually had me wishing I'd ordered that instead. He also got a banana shake. I'm not really into shakes and the banana shake had too much artificial banana flavoring for my liking, but it probably wouldn't be so bad for fans of banana-flavored dairy.

It's probably best not to come here alone unless you're 6.5" and built like a rock. However, the sketchy-looking people generally don't bother you. They might leer at you for a while, but then they usually find some other moving object to leer at.
author: Josephine L.

description:
This is it - one of the best burgers I have had ever! Great Milkshakes too! A true blast from the past - don;t let the neighbourhood or the looks of this place fool you. This place is the real deal for great food! I have gone to fancy places and the burgers do not measure up to this place.
Plus the prices are retro too!
author: Grant H.

description:
what i ordered... whiz burger

typical hamburger patties and fillings served in a faux sourdough bread


ambiance... bad (it looks like one of 'em structure in the ol' west movies)
service... so-so (a stare and a quick question but a single word of gratitude at the end)
cost... $ (fair)
author: Gors P.

description: 100 on the heath test, you know it's good.....but for real, great old school style drive in burgers...get drunk down the block then come here to get right
author: Danny and Christina M.

description: Owner was a jerk and so were his employees over a ranch.... owner was also eating while he was making food. Odd.
author: Jav V.

description: Want a good bacon cheeseburger, seasoned fries and a shake? This place nails it. I've had friends venture away from this recommendation and be disappointed, but my answer is don't stray from my advice.  Killer espresso malt shake!
author: S.B. C.

description:
A shining beacon of hope on the promenade of despair that is South Van Ness. If you want cheap and tasty burgers, dogs, fries, shakes and other morsels of Americana, this is your spot. A combo with fries and a drink is under $8, and only takes a few minutes to cook up. You can easily fill your stomach for under a ten-spot.

Note that this isn't a dine-in kind of place. It's a walkup window with a few picnic benches around. The view isn't great, but the eats are very good.

The junior burger was substantial enough for me, but don't let stop you from gorging yourself on a full-sized burg or a chili dog or what have you. They have veggie options, a turkey burger, and fish burger too. But obviously the truly health conscious should walk on by.

Me and the Dining Companion opted for onion rings and cross-cut fries instead of the regular old befrenched fries. You can do it too. Be the change you want to see in your potato world.

Obligatory Title Pun: Don't WHIZ past this gem.

Menu Readability: Check out the handpainted sign inside!

Need to mention: They have a perfect health score. And they accept cards.

What this place teaches me about myself: I really shouldn't paraphrase Gandhi in this context.
author: Vivek S.

description:
Sketch-y.  truly a unique "dining" experience.  Have you ever been to a drive up movie theater?  Well I haven't either, but this place surely reminds me of what that would be like.  The building is obviously run-down and the insides are left to the imagination with posters and menus posted all over the windowed store front so you can't see inside.  

The food was good, much to my surprise. Don't get me wrong, as I was happy to have paid for and eaten good food, but you don't expect what you end up getting dished out.  Whiz Burger is definitely a "classic" burger with mustard served on top of fresh shredded lettuce and a thin meat patty.  the flavors are bold and reminiscent of something you'd eat at a carnival.  A good carnival.

Make sure to try out the criss-cut fries as they were perfectly crispy and deliciously hot.  Bottom line - I'd go back.
author: Kevin J.

description: Cool & simpale place! Really nice if you are not looking gor something spaciel, just good fast good :)
author: Dana P.

description: This place is my jam. It is a Mission and San Francisco institution. When I first lived in San Francisco 15 years ago, this was a frequent lunch and dinner spot, being 2 blocks from home and 5 blocks from work. Now that I've been back in San Francisco for a year, I love every chance I get to cheat and pig out with the burger spot every In n' Out pretends to be. It's a simple burger stand, with parking, and outdoor picnic tables and a counter. It's old school, and it's glorious.
author: Justin S.

description: Yummy fries and a decent burger- satisfied my craving! Next time- definitely getting the banana shake and criss cut fries!
author: Alicia C.

description: Used to live near this place, and let me tell you, their Burgers are one of the most delicious burgers i ate in years. Been eating since 1995 and they still provide the right amount of fries and juicy burgers. definitely recommend this place for anyone dying to eat a burger and are close to the location.
author: Kevin J.

description: Love this old school drive in. The burgers and fries are delicious. The service and employees are fast and nice. Never close please.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Whiz Burgers was just fine--quick food, scalding-hot french fries, and tables outside to sit. 

Probably wouldn't have this as a frequent destination, but it did the trick on a hot Sunday afternoon.

The BLT was legit, and the fries, like I said, are made with lava and flavor. Maybe let them sit for a tic and let them cool, word to the wise.

The good: pretty diverse menu (tuna melt? Ok). 
The bad: it's the Mission, so be prepared to protect your food.
author: Amanda B.

description: Do you want a burger? Of course you do. Classic, simple, burgers made at a joint that doesn't presume to be more than the greasy corner burger shack it is. The shakes and malts are terrific, and pair well with the burger when you're really feeling like punishing your heart and rewarding your taste buds!
author: Patrick C.

description:
This review is for the only thing I've ever ordered from here. The #7 with criss-cut fries. The veggie burger is actually a high(er) quality than what most hole in the wall places would serve. I think it's made by Wildwood? I really wish Vin Diesel over @ Jay's Cheesesteak http://www.yelp.com/biz/jays-cheesesteak-san-francisco would use this burger. The price is ok but could be cheaper. 

I've been coming here for years, off & on, everything is pretty much the same as I remember except they take credit cards now. I always call ahead since they take forever to make your order. Besides, who actually eats here instead of taking it to-go?
author: John B.

description:
Waffle fries are bomb
$2 corn dog... yes!
Banana shake is awesome
Burgers are OK, but what the heck, it's convenient
author: Kevin K.

description:
greasy, hot, fresh, disgusting, and perfect. 

whiz burger is my favorite self indulgent lunch. mmmm. it's so bad, but so so good. 

I hope this place is around forever.
author: Cat G.

description: this is what i miss about the old san francisco......not frisco.....good food, great prices, good service.
author: M R.

description: There's a church right in front of the drive in, in case you want to pray for your sin of gluttony that you will commit after eating one of these burgers.
author: Sean D.

description: Decent burger, but geez a place famous for burgers and they have an entire chinese menu? The guy at the register didn't seem to understand me until I spelled my order out for him. Boo. I'll get a burger anywhere else next time
author: Nic T.

description:
Whiz Burger could use a bit of a fix me up. Their retro bar stools are now missing their cushioned tops and the place looks in dire need of a paint job. I like to think it's part of their charm. Either way, it is SO GOOD. There has been countless overhyped burger joints opening. Granted they're all amazing but sometimes you just want a greasy cheeseburger with no fuss and that isn't $15.

Look no further on the menu - the Whiz Burger is all you need. It's everything a classic burger should be. The bacon gives it just enough delicious fattiness (flavor!!), onions, lettuce, avocado, pickles, mustard and mayo completes it.

They have all the typical milkshake flavors but try their banana milkshake. It's sweet and just the right thick consistency.
author: Samantha L.

description:
+4 for being an ol' skool burger and fries *joint.* So ol' skool - you have to write your order down *on paper* and give it to the guy. That's ol-timey, man!

+4 for having very tasty fries. I have dreams of these fries. No joke.
author: Mark S. I.

description: Great burgers, small line a little wait but definitely satisfied.
author: Casper D.

description:
Such slow service! I don't understand why these two guys, the only guys who look like they're running the joint on a Tuesday night, look bored when there are five customers waiting out in the cold for their order! One customer cancelled their order since it took forever, and another had been waiting for at least 20 minutes.

One more star because the burger and fries tasted good. They were legit burgers, but I could probably find that elsewhere and with way better service.
author: Kris I.

description:
I've been here a few times with friends and overall the experiences have been "meh". San Francisco has a ton of great eateries, so there's a lot of competition out there, even for a classic institution. On the other hand, there aren't a lot of burger places in the Mission, which may be how Whiz Burgers has stayed in business.

The yays:
prices are low
hours are convenient
selection is good
hot greasy food generally hits the spot

The nays:
food is fair, with a couple notably bad dishes: chicken teriyaki, tuna melt
tables are in very bad shape
stools are near breaking point
I always feel like crap after eating here 

Despite my love of fries and shakes, and the convenience of Whiz Burgers, I can't see any reason to go back.
author: Kely G.

description:
We really liked Whiz Burger, it was great.   

We got 2 burger burgers with cheese, 1 seasoned fries (criss cut), onion rings, a soda, and a strawberry shake. The criss cut fries and onion rings were nothing to write home about. The burgers were delish. Great bun (perfect bun to meat/topping ration). Simple burger set up: mayo, lettuce, pickle, tomato, onion. Burger: 1/2 inch thick, well seasoned. The best way I can describe them is that they are similar to In-and-Out but better, and more homemade. The strawberry shake was also very good.  

We'll be back :)  

They had a health score of 100, awesome!
author: Lani N.

description: You can keep your $20 artisan gourmet Valencia St burgers. Whiz Burger has been here since 1955 for a reason, awesome burgers fries and shakes all around!!
author: O. S.

description: I live couple blocks away  and went here about 5 times and never got my order right. I confront the   cashier and he is just like you are out of luck. Whiz Burger has terrible customer service and the food is below In-n-out quality. DONT BOTHER with their nasty wet (yes, like water wet) french fries.   I wish someone would come take over who knows how to cook correctly.
author: Steve S.

description:
I was born in the mission and I have always known the place is there but never tried them before. 

I like a good old fashion burger but I really got suckered for the Philly cheesesteak. Well the pregnant wife wanted one. We ordered it with lettuce and tomato but it comes with grilled onions, bell peppers, mayo and cheese. I recommend put those veggies although it sounds weird. 

My only complaint of this place is retarded, knowing the element of the neighborhood, is the wooden tables and benches. I'm not complaining about the bird poop, I'm complaining that the tables haven't been changed since the earthquake of '89. 

Well overall it's a good place.
author: Vicente C.

description: Good ole fashioned drive up.  Good quality food.   Possibly the best corn dog in town too.
author: John W.

description:
Although the burger does the trick, what I fall hard for are:

1. The sign
2. The cheesesteak
3. Waffle fries
4. Tater tots
5. Chocolate malted banana milkshake
author: Amanda R.

description: This place what actually good. I had the Philly Cheese Steak. The meat was pretty tasty & made perfect down to the delicious local swiss cheese. Really yummy I also shared some of the chicken wings; they were deeeeply fried and I say deeeeply because I do mean it. Tasty but oily. The bf had a chicken burger which he said taste "meeeeh" so i took one star off.
author: Cassie S.

description:
Man oh man oh man oh man. I love this place! 

I was searching for a burger place in SF to call my own. I searched far and wide, but the burgers were either too expensive or too bland...or both! And then I stumbled upon this place.

What a pleasant surprise. In an overpriced city such as San Francisco it's nice to find a cheap place to eat with a whole lot of character. Their specialty is their Whiz Burger and boy is it special. They make a mighty fine banana shake as well. 

See ya there?
author: Murphy O.

description: Still the same after all these years, great burgers and greasy fries. It is good that some things don't change.
author: John E.

description: It's a grease bin, and an excellent one! It doesn't try to be something it isn't. The food is cooked and served fresh. The orders are always accurate. Love it.
author: Kelli L.

description: I've been coming here since I was a kid, burgers are great, and their banana milkshakes are to die for. Love mom & pop shops in The City Of Kings
author: Frisco K.

description:
Burger: just meh.
Banana milkshake: it brings all the boys to the yard.
Fries: number one.
Corn dog: number one (how can you mess this up anyways?).

Minus half a star for the crooked bench table top and low quality corn syrup ketchup.
author: Evan W.

description:
This place's burgers taste exactly like McDonald's burgers. Plus, I couldn't hear anything the guy at the window was saying.

On the bright side, they didn't mess up my burger. And the prices totally make sense.
author: Casey M.

description:
Well, 3.5 stars.

I love novelty 50's style burger places! On my way to church one day I took a different route and drove by this little place and it immediately caught my eye. After church I convinced a friend to come with me to try this place out.

I ordered the fish sandwich meal and my friend ordered the philly cheesesteak. Both were delicious. Honestly I ate here a while ago, so I can't remember specifics, but I will definitely come back. Just wish it wasn't in a seedy part of the neighborhood, but it was satisfying :)
author: Becky K.

description: The worst food I've had in a long time. If I hadn't been desperately hungry, I would have just thrown it in the trash. I got a tuna melt that was literally just white bread, tuna, and American cheese. I don't understand how a restaurant can be so terrible and stay in business.
author: Jakob H.

description:
Two is pushing it and only for longevity do I give it such high marks. Go visit this relic. 

The beef was flavorless and the fries were just horriable oh and the coke was flat and the bun was dry.  The plus side; I got to eat outside in front of the restaurant in the parking lot with the pigeons. 

I won't be back except maybe to take a picture of the old school sign.
author: Justin S.

description: This place is solid, I like that is unchanged and run down but still serves good food and a great banana shake! Some reviewers say it's in a seedie neighborhood, but as I look around all I see are hipsters and Lyft drivers. Places like this will be gone soon so come try a shake!
author: Chris M.

description: I want to love this place.  But I think that the oil in the fryers has been there since 1955. And I swear that they deep fried my veggie burger in it. Soft serve ice cream is okay. I don't want then to go all hipster. But just step it up a tad in the fresh dept.
author: Sarah P.

description: Pretty freakin' awesome. Look at me I'm yelping. Mediocre burgers and fries. Lots of crack and prost's. There's a camp area behind the store. Clarence rents his tent out by the hour. He says he's just down on his luck.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Dearest Whiz Burger,
I miss you so much. I used to order seasoned fries, a banana milkshake and a veggie burger from here whenever my dad was feelin' like a burger and fries. Holy mother of YES. I just miss this place so much. I basically grew up eating their burgers all the time. This was my in-n-out before in-n-out in Daly City came into existence. This place is legit, but i wouldn't recommend actually eating there. It's rather unsanitary. Take it to go. I'd give it one more star if the seats weren't full of bird shit.
author: Kai S.

description:
Oh Whiz, you gritty little Mission delight. I completely agree with the overall 3.5 star rating. There is just something so quintessential San Franciscan about this corner dive. While you will never see a tourist stop here (bless the heavens), I also don't think we will ever see Guy Fieri or Anthony Bourdain featuring the joint, but I adore it.

I ordered my junior burger meal deal, aka #1, and sat down to watch the show. A random sampling of who might appear - a pimp, the homeless, the hipsters, the business person, but somehow it all works. It's loud, the buses stop out front, it's grimy, but damn it makes me smile every time. It sings San Francisco! 

I enjoy the burgers, the chicken sandwich and the turkey burgers. The fries are thick cut and cooked perfectly. It's not the best burger around, but there is just something delightful about the whole experience. The burger reminds me of grilling out at my parents' house on a hot summer day. The burger is a little more done than I like, the bun is not completely fresh, the shredded lettuce is a tad watery, but I swear to you it is so damn good! The mustard and mayo combines and creates this creamy, tangy sauce that clings to the lettuce shreds and adds a certain dimension of flavor. 

I would never dream of taking an out-of-towner here, but if you live or work in the city then I believe it is a must-experience experience! It just works and it's just so good! Check it out, fo' sho'.
author: Shannon K.

description: Got the corn dog, it was average but I devoured it because I was starving. However, the wait was super long for a corn dog! The crowd was mixed, family members, young chic couples, but also very colorful and sketch figures. Would love to see the picnic tables, counters, and the windows cleaned or revamped and painted or something.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
Props for being here since 1955!

I got the burger burger, which I was told was basically the Whiz burger without avocado and bacon.  The meat was almost like highschool lunch burger mystery meat, on par with McDonalds.  Luckily it came with pickles and enough mustard to mask the taste.  

I stopped by while walking my dog (there aren't many places that you can grab food with a dog, well a large dog).  I wanted to sit outside and eat, but seriously there were too many homeless people and my dog was scared.

I heard their shakes are amazing- too bad I'm lactose intolerant. 

Cool that it's still around, but run down, and almost gross
author: Skye W.

description:
Im only giving it two stars because the food was decent.

Otherwise my experience was kind of shitty.

The guy at the register took my order for a number 1, which includes fries and a drink, and when my food came up he didn't supply the drink. I asked for the drink and he told me that I didnt get a drink because I added cheese to my burger and it is an extra charge.

So I had to sit there and argue his logic with him for several minutes after he tried to send me off without giving me what I had paid for.

It was annoying and disappointing. I don't think that they should have tried to swindle me out of the drink that I paid for and then treat me like I was stupid all explain to them how wrong they were for trying to swindle me.

Give me what I pay for. That is all I ask.
author: Eric G.

description:
This is an old school Hamburger stand that's been there since 1955. It's one of those quirky throwbacks that you run into from time to time.

I've eaten here a few times over the last ten years just for the novelty of it, and you should to, but to be honest the burgers are only average.
author: Manny F.

description: Not to much for the whiz burger, but boy do they give you enough fries. Since this was my first time there I give it another try. I will ask the locals what to get. Says its been there a long time and it looked it, but looks are deceiving.
author: Biggg J.

description:
I was stomping up Van Ness from the Dog Patch towards Mission, and I saw this diner and decided to do lunch.  i wasn't quite sure what to expect, since this place appears to have been largely unchanged from the '50's (you can't fake the patina!), except for the San Francisco prices of course.
I got a turkey burger with garlic fries and although I was sour they stuck me an extra $2.50 to upgrade to the garlic fries, when they came out I saw that not only was it a much larger order but they had actually fried the garlic and put it on the fries.  The turkey burger was prime quality... meat and juicy with a nice bouncy bun and crisp lettuce.  The garlic fries pretty much guaranteed that nobody wanted to get within 3 feet of me for the next few hours, which made walking through the crowded Mission that much easier.  And it was nice to sit out on the old wooden table in the lovely SF weather and gnaw on a burger.
Pro tip: get the banana shake if you get the garlic fries to mitigate the destruction.  Unless you're worried about vampires of course.

All in all I'd say this is a fun place to go once (or twice if you have a craving), but there's little to put it on your short list.
author: David S.

description:
First, the place is really cool because of location and architecture.  Granted it is a drive in but there aren't many other unique places like this in the city.

Second, the burger burger is freaking delicious.  Sesame bun toasted right, fresh vegetables, good burger meat and cooked right.

Third, the fries have a taste of fries.  Other places burn the fries and they are just crisped shells of what a fry should be.  It also comes in a little bag so you don't lose them all over the place.  

Fourth, it's affordable.  If you try burger urge in the haight, the same meal of fries, burger, and beverage is $18.  It's $8 here.
author: E M.

description:
Whiz Burger is a solid old school burger stand.  It is not in the best neighborhood.  I am a big guy, and I can take care of myself, but I don't invite danger.  My spider sense tingles every time I go to this place as soon as I turn my back to the street and step up to the window to order.  This is not an eat-in place.  The outdoor stools and picnic tables, forget it.  This is an eat it in your car or at home far away from here kind of place.

Location aside, their bacon double is FANTASTIC.  Their fries are solid.  Shakes are good enough.

It is worth a try, but go at sun up and take it home with you.
author: Shaun H.

description:
The mango ice cream cone is unbeatable. It's gigantic, inexpensive, and tastes fabulous.
If you're afraid of the The Mission you are not only behind the times, but you shouldn't come here. For all the rest of us, it's a great place.
author: Carl C.

description:
This review is currently ONLY for the chocolate malted milkshake. It was good, rich and a little foamy (I prefer less foamy which is why I gave 3 stars instead of 4) :)

I've been meaning to eat a burger at this place for over a year haha so I have every intention of coming back and trying the burger and fries. When I do, I will revisit and edit this review. Maybe it will go up one star, maybe it wont... muajajaja (attempt at evil laugh in a not applicable situation :) )
author: Gerardo C.

description: No bueno, as in not that good. Ordered the whiz special, no onions. Got to work and found there were onions in my order. Ended up making a mess getting those onions out. I'd rather drive an hour out the city next time to find a better burger spot. The only think that makes up for the nasty burger was the delicious strawberry shake.
author: Elliot C.

description: I can only give a review on their milkshakes because that's all I've had.  My husband had a chocolate malted milkshake and I had a chocolate banana milkshake...both were so yummy.  I'm not even a big fan of malt, but I would totally have a malted milkshake from here.
author: Rose A.

description: Stumbled upon this place while looking for something quick to eat. Awesome burger for cheap.
author: Thomas C.

description:
This 1950s old-school outdoor-seating-only burger joint has really great "curb appeal", as the realtors say. 

The food, however, barely reaches marginal quality. Damnit, you WANT it to be better, as this would be on the way to a foodie perfect moment. Alas, it's not to be. 

Okay fries, good condiments, but what tastes like only the best frozen 'B'-quality meat. Better than starvation, but only just. 

Keep driving. Your stomach will thank you.
author: Michael S.

description:
Whiz Burger is a place that you don't want to admit to enjoying. It's an old fashioned drive it and fast food at it's greasiest. However, it's a San Francisco classic and when you are up for a splurge (I do mean calories, not cash) it's worth it! It's exactly what you would expect burgers and fries, shakes and malts. Not exactly culinary grandeur but what do you expect from a fast food burger joint. You could go to a big chain burger place or enjoy a snap shot from San Francisco days past. 

Pros
- The shakes, malts and root beer floats
- Seasoned fries
- Pretty good burger (not as greasy as some)
- Takes credit cards

Cons
- The regular fries are bland and not worth the calories!
- Closes down fairly early
author: Marissa P.

description: A nice break from hip foodie cuisine. Veggie patty is as good as the one at southern pacific. Chocolate milkshake=perfect. & thick creamy ranch for seasoned criss cut fries. What more could you want?
author: Yvonne Q.

description:
I was craving good, simple food to take home, having just flown back from a 48hr trip for an east coast trade show. I got the Whiz Burger and I'd recommend it to anyone else looking for something quick to eat/order. 

My meal definitely was better than expected, maybe because of the delicious french fries. I couldn't get enough of them! Hopefully pre-salting isn't all that it takes to satisfy my fry taste buds. I don't think I was that worn out.

The building and its location weren't a big deal. I enjoyed Whiz more than Beeps, which is set up similarly. Parking next to the building, followed by a quick to-go order, was perfect for me. When I walked up to the window, a guy came around from the back counter and was on his cell phone. For some reason, this didn't surprise me. I went asked the dumb question of, "What's on a Whiz Burger?" because the toppings seemed to be a mystery on all three types of menus in front of me. He didn't blink though....rolling out bacon/avocado and then all of the other toppings. Guy's a pro.

The shake was ready after a few minutes. I'm not a shake guy but Yelp reviews encouraged me to try it. The actual strawberries used were appreciated. The burger and fries came out just a few minutes later. Pretty darn fast. In that time, one person was ahead of me, and two followed with orders at 5pm. (Remember, my body was feeling 8pm, especially after the previous night.)

It was a good deal: $12 for a burger with bacon, avocado, adding cheese, along with fries and a shake. Sure, we can spend hard-earned money at a ton of places in the Mission, not to mention all of SF, but very few places make fries THIS GOOD. Am I too easily pleased by salty fries? Maybe, maybe not. Go there yourself, and then let me know.
author: Mike H.

description: I've been going to this place for the past 15 years and I still love it. Hamburgers, the waffle fries and the vanilla shakes are my favorite. Service has been a bit slow lately but still delicious!
author: Marlo M.

description:
I have walked and driven past Whiz Burgers for many years. Finally, I was hungry enough to walk up and order something. Yesterday I pulled into their lot (easy to park-- yay!) and ordered a garden burger with extra pickles, plus a medium Coke. It took maybe ten minutes for me to get my order, but gosh, that garden burger was good! It came neatly wrapped in a small bag with ketchup packets and a straw for the drink. I ate half of it right then and the other half later, when it was still good. The veggie burger has a smoky flavor to it that made it extra delicious. 

All for $7.50, not dirt cheap but definitely reasonable in our town for the meal I received.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I use to live a few houses away from Whiz ever since i was born in 1985. Whiz burger is a good decent place. To this day, it's still a good decent place. Good burgers and good memories. 
5 stars for still being around and bringing me back memories when i'm around.
author: Nelson M.

description: After buying my hamburger combo meal, the first thing I noticed was the the price of the combo was actually the same price as buying a burger, fries and a drink separately. Not sacrilege, but not a good look; kinda felt like they were calling me stupid. I sat down with my meal and it was all around sub-par. The fries had enough salt on them for 3 orders, the vegetables were not fresh (inexcusable for ant California dining establishment), and they give out only a few of these wimpy ketchup packets that hold less than a teaspoon, forcing you to ration out your ketchup, only to run out before finishing the meal. Doesn't take a whiz to figure out there are better burger joints.
author: Diesel S.

description: Like my second kitchen. Sad but true. The turkey burger, grilled chicken sandwich, The corn dogs, and the fries are great. The veggie burger is gross. The ice cream cones are the secret tip: hearty and quality (may be Mitchell's) for only $1.85. The shakes are great.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Banana shake is fantastic, as well as the waffle fries!

The burger was just ok- kinda thin (not a good meat to bread ratio), i asked for "medium rare" and it was closer to well done, and the bacon (yuck) was perhaps the fattiest bacon i've even encountered.

Still looking for that perfect burger....
author: D F.

description:
I'll make this short- 

Want some burger goodness on the fly for cheap? Whizzzz burger!
sidenote: and I am a vegetarian, so can't speak for the meat.

Here's what ya gotta try:

Special: Veggie Burger with (get the crosscut) fries & large drink
** and the Banana shake is amazing!


-1 star short of a perfect rating for all the grease & possible tummy ache later. but yummy overall.
author: Julie L.

description:
The awesome storefront at the Whiz suckered me into getting one of their burgers. It oozes 50's charm out of that big glass window, over the picnic tables and onto Van Ness. 

I was hoping the burger would have the same sort of personality, if it's possible for a burger to have one. Yeah, burgers can have personalities.

The guy at the counter asked if I wanted everything on it and I said yes, assuming that meant lettuce, pickle, tomato, onion...the burger basics. I didn't know it meant adding bacon, avocado, and more cheese at an extra charge. Oh well, I thought, more toppings more flavor. 

Despite the extra fixins the Whiz Burger was just bland. The meat wasn't great and it fell apart as soon as it was unwrapped. And I would say it was more of a hoagie with hamburger meat on it than an actual burger. 

It's worth the visit just for the building but don't expect to be blown away by the Whiz Burger. Their root beer was bangin, though.
author: Corbin C.

description:
I would give this place 6 stars if they had vegenaise and sriracha for my veggie burger.  Sometimes you just need to go that extra mile on your own.

Ps.  Jalapenos.
author: steve m.

description: Good food love the burger the crosscut fries is a bit expensive also love the garlic fries love their coffee milkshake
author: Heat L.

description:
The steak sandwich is probably just 3 stars. It's tasty and works well with the toppings they put on it, but it's nothing special... Kal's Bar-B-Q in Sunnyvale is a lot better in that regard. But I can't give this place 3 stars as a whole... the malted shake I had was amazing and the retro look is intriguing.

It's a bit awkward having to sit at a picnic table in the Mission District when you go here... I imagine a lot of the patrons opt to get their food to go rather than eating at one of the few tables they have outside.

Overall, I plan to return again and try a burger. I'll consider the steak sandwich as well, but I'd like to try more things here.
author: Jesse R.

description:
Wow! 5 stars, definitely. 

For years I had avoided Whiz Burger for a myriad of reasons. It's on the corner of Shady Lane and Ghetto Way for starters. It looks physically run down, just like most hipster joints - and sorry, but that doesn't exactly scream 'sanitary' or 'delicious' to me. Also, it's a burger joint and I'm a vegetarian, so we're automatically at odds with each other. 

But, my curiosity got to me this time. I walked past and noticed their giant menu, and mango and banana milkshakes screamed out at me. So I kept looking, and to my surprise I saw grilled cheese and veggie burgers. And I was hungry, so thought, 'what the hell?' 

The veggie burger was AWESOME! It was the tofu kind, I think it tasted like Wildwood, which is my absolute fav. It stayed delicious even after it was luke warm. AND? They have seasoned fries. And they were amazing. Light, fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside. I abstained from getting a shake, but I will next time.

Mmmm. Next time....
author: Amber K.

description:
Passed by Whiz many times and wanted to try.
Had a burger / fries  lunch.....hmmm, it was GEE WHIZ but not in a good way. Cool looking place. Grouchy folks taking the food order. Hamburger was well, basic at best. Fries were OK, a bit soggy. 

Yah, if you live next to Whiz Burger and don't care what you are eating, Whiz is for you. If you are passing by....just Whiz on by, keep going. 
Not a place that will see me a second time.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
This is pretty terrible food, but bad in a way that is like how a really bad movie can be good and surprisingly entertaining.

Now and then, because I live down the street, I need something quick and cheap. 

And I need that special Whiz taste.

That's when I go to Whiz Burger.  Turkey burger is not bad.  I like that there is not another place like this in SF.

Sometimes you gotta get your food Whizzed on.
author: Paul S.

description:
Came by with a friend to eat burgers. 

I ordered the mushroom burger and garlic fries, my friend ordered the burger burger. While we waited, we sat on the wooden tables and chairs. They seemed pretty dirty. 

The food took like 15 minutes to make. 

The garlic fries were pretty good, I wish they could've added a little more garlic. The burger was just dull, flat and boring. NO FLAVOR in the cheese, beef, mushrooms. 

If I'm in the area and craving garlic fries, I'll give it a second chance and check out other things in the menu too.
author: Sophia G.

description:
Whiz Burger Haiku

Come for the burger
Homeless drunks ask for your change
"Sorry, just spent it"
author: Shannon N.

description:
Confession one:  I am a vegetarian who hates veggie burgers.  It's like eating a bread sandwich, but worse--I mean, I actually like bread. 

Confession two:  I a sucker for anything old and/or divey.  

So when the boy, on an eager quest to find the best burger in the city, said 'Whiz Burger', I was in.  When he said 'the veggie burgers are really good' I was skeptical.  

I am happy to report that--omg--the veggie burgers are. really. good.  They're made of tofu and vegetables and get crispy on the outside, and are nothing at all like a bread sandwich. 

That, plus waffle fries and half a fresh banana shake, left me in food coma all Sunday.
author: Dana S.

description: Amazing burger and shakes. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, authentic burgers. Most bad reviews on here seem to be based on pretty isolated experiences.
author: Philip M.

description:
Look, your not going to find a fancy burger joint here. The place is physically falling apart... which is awesome for me because the food is so good that the unappealing aspects of the place keeps the line short :)

I look forward to my climbing days over at mission cliffs just for my trip to Whiz Burger right after.
I have never had a more delicious hamburger. Hands down.
author: Lotan K.

description: I like the food, it was good for the money. But when I was told that the three dollar shake was almost 8 bucks because it was the largest size. I felt like the employee thought I was a tourist, because the chocolate shake was not any bigger than the 3 dollar shake I had the day before. I have not gone back, because I don't want to get ripped off again. The same meal cost me about 12 bucks the day before with the same shake size and that day I paid 20 bucks for the double cheesebuger plain and the large shake with fry's, same meal.
author: Sean G.

description: Make sure you go to the right window, they will ignore you even though you are standing at the other window. I guess when they say order here, it really means order here. Just got a milkshake before dinner and it was chocolately but not too overpowering. Kinda of like every other milkshake.
author: Eve C.

description:
Whiz Burger has some awesome grub, I'll tell you that. The signature eponymous burger comes complete with avocado for a nice departure from the ordinary burger joint offering. There's also vegetarian options, chicken burgers, etc. Garlic fries, shakes, you can get what you need here to get that burger joint fill.

The real neat thing about The Whiz is the outdoor seating which is especially awesome when the weather cooperates.

Prices are a little steep, but you get a nice portions, so you can't really complain.
author: Wes T.

description:
Yes, as others have written but I had to experience for myself, the allure of the burger stand/drive-in is dusted by the lame food. Such a shame, because this could be such a gold pot. Missionites would love it.

I had a cheese burger and chocolate shake- that was all I needed from this place. The burger was tasteless and the cheese not melted. The chocolate shake was okay.
author: Lis C.

description:
Don't mistake this four star review for tacit approval. This is a disgusting, borderline hazardous hell hole. Even the food items I'm comfortable consuming I can't vouch for entirely. You have to embrace the concept of beneficial stress to really get behind ordering food here. Actually dining at the outside tables would be taking things past bravado and on down into "cry for help" behavior. Eating your food at the bar stools with your back to Van Ness is up there with bending over for soap in jail or taking pills you find on the ground (both of which have more than a tangential relationship with Whiz Burger as a whole). 

With that said, I really really like the titular Whiz Burger. The right amount of everything; cheese, beef, bacon, and avocado in proportionate moderation, cooling tomato, iceberg lettuce, onion, condiments on a nice, soft, toasted roll. The redundant "Burger Burger" is actually a single, reasonable burger. I won't belabor the rest, it's all what you'd expect. 

Take a walk on the wild side but eat it at home and keep your guard up while waiting like Inspector Cleaseu coming home to Kato (i.e. calm, friendly but prepared to defend yourself).
author: Milk N.

description:
The burger was pretty tasty (avocado wasn't ripe -- blech!).  Both the regular and spicy waffle fries were very tasty.  

Unfortunately, my digestive tract did not enjoy dinner so much.  I went with a friend who can eat anything, and she had some problems with it, too.  Even if you have the stomach for it, Whiz Burger's food is nothing special.
author: Rachel C.

description: The Bananna Shake, and cross-cut fries. 'Nuff Said.
author: Connor E.

description:
I love their veggie burger here.

It's cheap, it's relatively quick to get, and hey, this place is an awesome venue to get it from (have you ever seen this place??). Cool joint for sure.

You order at the window & sit outside. Nice :)

Totally love the restaurant as a whole & will def. be back!

Try the veggie burger!
author: Kai S.

description: Milkshake,burger,fries are yummy.. My son doesn't like eating burger but this place is his favorite spot. Been here 4 times and still keep coming back, friendly staff and definitely going back for more.
author: Mark G.

description: I've enjoyed food here before but my last visit was spoiled by bad service. When I order a cheeseburger I expect it to come with cheese. Slapping a cold unmelted piece on after the mistake is pointed out does not turn it into a cheeseburger. By the time I've had to send my food back twice it's time to get a refund and go elsewhere. So I did.
author: Jade J.

description:
I've passed by Whiz Burger so many times and have always wanted to come here! I love the old school and somewhat ghetto look of the place, and often times places like these can be the gems that surpass newer and fancier places. 

During our sub-par garage sale, I walked over here with my sweet baby on this past sunny Saturday afternoon.  I ordered the turkey burger with cheese meal, and my lady ordered the veggie burger solo (so we shared the fries and drink). Our total was around $14, which I guess isn't too bad. It turned out to be plenty of food so I'm glad we opted to not get the additional order of fries.

My turkey burger was big and tasty, and had all the fixins. The fries were really good, and there's nothing I dislike more than a crappy fry. Overall I thought my food was pretty good!

One thing I didn't really like was the way you order. You go up to the window, which is fine, but they didn't give me a receipt or a number. My lady had to stay and claim the table and I stood around by what I assumed was food window. It would be nice if they just called out your number when your food was ready so you don't stand there hovering like an idiot!

Other than that, I would come back to Whiz Burger; perhaps for a shake next time!
author: Audrey K.

description: Whenever we pass by this place, we always say, "Next time." We finally took the plunge and tried it. Not the best place to go to if you are trying to eat healthy but who the heck cares. We tried the Bacon Cheeseburger. It was big and delish. Bacon makes things better. If you order the large fries, you will get a Large fries. The onion rings are ok. The seasoned fries are nice and flavorful. Can you tell we didn't hold back?! And the banana milkshake was creamy and fresh. For a junk food fast food fix (if you don't want the normal McD's or BK, etc.) this is a good place to go.
author: Mel P.

description:
Upon my first visit to Whiz Burger I was distracted from ordering by a hobo searching the contents of their garbage can. The hobo was so dirty he looked like a coal miner. The elastic band in his athletic pants had long since succumbed to the stress of the hobo lifestyle. This allowed myself and church goers across the street a clear view of his dirty hobo underwear. Except he wasn't wearing any underwear.

Exhausted in his effort to liberate some fries, and then some ketchup from the trash, he laid out on the sidewalk for a much needed rest. A few minutes later he awoke and began eating the bounty that laid waiting before him. It was at this point I lost my appetite and went home.

If you should see a hobo wearing a toeless sneaker on one foot and on the other, a black boot, you may also want to pray for his soul.
author: Dinner Dog X.

description:
We call this place the church of Whizzlam for a reason.
Get get GET a banana shake.
Also, bomb veggie burgers? Be still my I stopped eating meat! This makes me so happy!

Only con: the grilled cheese is definitely a miss. I cracked mine open and put fries inside and everything was a-ok, then, though.
author: Erin P.

description: Whiz burger is the perfect place to go for a great yet simple burger. With great burgers, tasty fries, and delicious shakes, This place is worth the time.
author: Michael E.

description: Bad business !!!!!! so when you go eat here make sure you save your receipt!!!! The owner called to have my car towed by Eagels Towing and road service after I walked around the corner to check aout the area for about 10 minutes .$8 burger towing $300 so I would have to say the burger was not worth it !
author: Kristi C.

description: Even though I lived nearby for a year, I had NEVER been to Whiz until this afternoon.  DANG that's a great burger!  I ordered a Whiz burger w American cheese and everything (not knowing what was on it) and a banana shake.  The shake was handmade and featured a perfectly ripe and then-peeled banana and was totally delicious.  The Whiz, it turns out, includes my two favorite burger tops - bacon and avocado.  This is a great burger!  It was also a double decker.  $11 for the pair, I'm a huge fan and I will definitely go back and dive deeper into the menu.
author: Matt S.

description:
3 stars for the novelty of the place, and the resilience of lasting for so long.

Food itself is just ok. I don't get using a french roll for a bun (was this a new thing to try and compete w/trendier burger joints, or a carryover from the 60s? either way. no bueno). 

As far as retro burgers go, I prefer Beep's over Whiz. And Bartel's over all else.
author: Sabine S.

description: Love the Whiz. My favorite is the steak sandwich with fries. My first time here I came with low expectations, but I love it. It's one of those places that I just gotta have when I get the craving.
author: C. H.

description:
A true rip off!

I went here for a fish burger, small onion rings, and a small banana shake...$13.  The fish burger, shake, and onion rings should have been appropriately titled "mini". The quality was poor and all except the shake (half decent) tasted bland.
author: Nyla S.

description: Had their bacon burger, criss-cut fries, and a banana milkshake. The fries were great, the bacon burger is distinctive (though could be a little more so), and the milkshake is as good as you'd expect. I may choose this place over In-n-Out if I were somehow put in that awkward position.
author: Epicurean _.

description: We live nearby and have been going for years. Try the banana shake or chocolate malted milk shake, waffle fries, and a cheeseburger. Location/set up is convenient and while it is kind of ghetto, I would never be afraid to go and get some food here.
author: Leo P.

description:
Whiz Burger's burgers and fries are okay, maybe even good.  The milkshakes are good.  The service is fair, and somewhat prompt.  The prices aren't great, but aren't horrible.  For this, the restaurant gets 3 stars.

The restaurant has one other feature, however, which I can't fail to mention.

/enable rant mode

The restaurant also rents out parking the lot behind the restaurant.  About $100/month, but also on a daily basis.  Because I live nearish to the restaurant, I rented parking there for a month.  One day, I returned to discover my car gone.  After the initial "Oh my god, someone stole my car" hysteria had passed, and after long investigation with the manager, I found out the story went this way:

Whiz Burger is near a Korean church.  There had been a funeral at that church that afternoon.  Many of the attendees had parked in the Whiz Burger lot without paying, so the owner of Whiz Burger called and had all the cars in the lot towed during the service.  Including my car, despite the prominently-displayed parking pass.

Now, before we talk about poor Ben and all the trouble I was put to because the owner of Whiz Burger can't be troubled to actually check the cars before having anyone towed, let's remember this: he had the cars of the funeral attendees towed DURING THE SERVICE.  If there was going to be a procession to the grave site, that's right out the window.  Even if there wasn't, you now have a bunch of people walking out of a funeral who now have to deal with getting their cars back.  Executive summary says: WHAT A DICK MOVE!

But back to me and my problems.  I now have to get in a dirty, stinky, cramped tow truck and ride to the tow company's beautiful headquarters in wonderful Hunter's Point, return my car and drive back home.  Why do -I- have to do this?  It's not like any of this is my fault.  But the tow company politely refused to return my car any other way.  The tow truck driver also felt the need to try to explain to me why none of this was his company's fault.  Great move!  I guess it's judgment like this that has resulted in you having a career as a tow truck driver.

I now pay $160/month to park elsewhere, but at least when I go to get my car, it's where I left it.  And, really, isn't that THE WHOLE FREAKING POINT?????

/end rant

So, 1 star for Whiz Burger.
author: Ben P.

description:
Before Bender's burned the fuck down, we'd hang out there for really two primary reasons: 1. Jessi and 2. the close proximity to Whiz Burger.

Whiiiizzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz Buuuuuurrrrrggggeeeeerrr.

That's how it sounds when I say its name after I chomp the H outta Whiz Burger's box. Perhaps y'all see the Whiz as a dude or, to be fair, someone a little in between, but I'm pret-ty sure the place is a straight up chick with, like, huge tits and the mouth of a sailor.  And if you don't eat everything off your motherfucking plate, you know bitch is gonna rectify the situation one way or another. 

So you better just eat it.

Or perhaps I just make up dick-tarded scenarios as a sorry means to justify eating like the Midwesterner that I am.
author: Chloe S.

description:
word,

There something to be said about diner food. Diner food really represents the true ideals of America as diner food completely disregards any idea of health or nutrition in the search of the all-American, all-pleasing taste rush. When in doubt deep-fry it. Pour that salt on that. Liquid sugar side drink? Oh you know it. Barely cooked beef? Yes, yes 1000x yes!

That being said Whiz Burger could only be more American if you installed a Statute of liberty on top of the building that played the tune to 'God bless America,' while the 1985 Bears sing and do the 'Super Bowl Shuffle'.  

The design of Whiz Burger is awesomely great as it looks like a relic from a by-gone era of the 1950s when diner food actually WAS considered healthy and nutritious. Unlike other wannabe 50's diners **cough cough Lori's DIner cough cough **** Whiz Burger was indeed built in the 50s, and not just some lame corporate gimmick.
